camel.source.path.command.name: camel.source.path.command
camel.source.path.command.description: What command to execute such as blobstore or compute. One of: [blobstore] [compute]

camel.source.path.providerId.name: camel.source.path.providerId
camel.source.path.providerId.description: The name of the cloud provider that provides the target service (e.g. aws-s3 or aws_ec2).

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.container.name: camel.source.endpoint.container
camel.source.endpoint.container.description: The name of the blob container.

camel.source.endpoint.directory.name: camel.source.endpoint.directory
camel.source.endpoint.directory.description: An optional directory name to use

camel.component.jclouds.blobStores.name: camel.component.jclouds.blobStores
camel.component.jclouds.blobStores.description: To use the given BlobStore which must be configured when using blobstore.

camel.component.jclouds.computeServices.name: camel.component.jclouds.computeServices
camel.component.jclouds.computeServices.description: To use the given ComputeService which must be configured when use compute.

camel.component.jclouds.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.jclouds.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.jclouds.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.jclouds.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.jclouds.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.jclouds.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
